page.title: 12Linfold Farm
page.content: Mr Osmaston owns Linfold Farm.He was brought up on a farm.When he left school he became an engineer and then he had a chance to own Linfold Farm so he did.Now he has been twenty years on the farm and has got one hundred and forty acres.He has a small tractor. He has got fifty three suckler cows,twenty eight yearlings and thirty calves.The dairy farmer uses silage in the winter for cows. Farmers try to grow as many crops as they can and the farming season starts about autumn.The farmers have to spray the corn with fertilizer and then leave it.With a combine harvester you could do twenty to thirty acres a day.
